full_summary:
# Request for Supply Arrangement: General Contractor and Renovation Services

**Request Title / Titre de la Demande**
Parks Canada Agency is seeking a Supply Arrangement for General Contractor and Renovation Services in Prince Edward Island.

**RFSA Details / Détails de la demande**

*   **RFSA ID / ID de la demande**: PW-22-01016319
*   **RFSA Date / Date de la Demande**: December 7, 2022
*   **RFSA Closing Date / Date de Clôture** December 19, 2023, at 13:00 (EST)
*   **Contract Type / Type de Contrat**: Supply Arrangement (SA)
*   **Procurement Method / Méthode d'approvisionnement**: Competitive - Open Bidding
*   **Bid Language / Langue des offres**: Either official language of Canada (French or English)

**Contract Description / Description du contrat**
Parks Canada Agency requires the services of General Contractors to manage all aspects of multi-discipline projects, including renovation and construction of various equipment, services, or structures, in Prince Edward Island. The contractor will be responsible for planning, organizing, and controlling the work, as well as the health and safety of all tradespeople working on the project.

**Contract Value / Valeur du contrat**
The contract value will vary and can go up to a maximum of $100,000.00 (inclusive of applicable taxes).

**Period of Contract / Période du Contrat**
The Supply Arrangement will be valid from the date of award to September 30, 2025.

**Security Requirement / Exigences en matière de sécurité**
There is no security requirement applicable to this Supply Arrangement.

**Submission Requirements / Exigences de soumission**
Bidders that consider themselves qualified to provide these services and intend to submit a bid on this project should obtain the solicitation documents from the Government Electronic Tendering Service through the Government of Canada tendering service at [www.buyandsell.gc.ca/tenders](http://www.buyandsell.gc.ca/tenders).

**Additional Information / Informations supplémentaires**

*   National Parks Regulations require that all work is to be performed in accordance with the ordinances, laws, rules, and regulations set out in the National Park Act.
*   Bidders that elect to base their bids on documents obtained from other sources do so at their own risk.
*   Late submissions will not be considered.
*   The Crown
